parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any specific parliamentary candidate by name, surname, or any other clear identifier.  The content focuses on the conflict in Ukraine and related geopolitical events.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. This is a paid Facebook post, inherently designed to reach a wide audience. The content is not a private message or personal communication.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. The primary objective of the post appears to be news reporting and analysis of international political events, specifically the conflict in Ukraine. While the topic is political, there is no explicit or implicit attempt to influence voters' choices in the parliamentary elections.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post's style and content align with journalistic reporting. It presents news summaries and analysis of international events, without advocating for any particular candidate or party.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>Not applicable. The post does not express personal opinions unrelated to the news reporting.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1646409259275642</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post focuses on reporting and analysis of the ongoing conflict in Ukraine.  It does not mention any parliamentary candidates or parties, nor does it attempt to influence voters' choices in the upcoming elections. The post's content and style are consistent with journalistic reporting, aiming to inform the public about international political events.  There is no evidence suggesting an intention to promote or hinder any candidate's electoral prospects.  The fact that it's a paid advertisement does not automatically qualify it as electoral propaganda; the content itself must be analyzed. In this case, the content is purely informational and does not violate Article 98 t).
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>Strategic Media Team srl</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
